div.p: SOLANDRA, in botany : A genus of plants belonging to the claſs of monodelphia, and to the order of polyandria ; and in the natural ſyſtem arranged under the 38th order, Tricocceœ. The calyx is ſimple; the capſule oblong, wreathed, and five-celled ; the ſeeds are many, diſpoſed in cells in a double order. The valves after maturity are divaricated, even to the baſe, and winged inwards by the partition. The only ſpecies is the Lobata. This genus was firſt named Solandra, in honour of Dr Solander, by Murray in the 14th edition of the Systema Vegetabilium.
